Description: Grammatical ostracon: red pottery ostracon with text written in black pigment on both sides. On the front are seventeen lines of grammatical exercises in Greek and Coptic.
Bibliographic references: Parkinson 1999 / Cracking Codes: The Rosetta Stone and Decipherment (28)
Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.38, pl.31)
Hasitzka 1990 / Neue Texte und Dokumentation zum Koptisch-Unterricht (p.221-222)
Cribiore 1996 / Writing, teachers, and students on Graeco-Roman Egypt (no. 378)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (65421) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/65421)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Rev Greville John Chester
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 31:3 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
